monogr.title: Gods rebuke in taking from vs that worthy and honourable gentleman Sir Edward Lewkenor Knight, the first day of May this present yeere 1618, he being at that time high Sheriffe of Suffolke : whose Christian life and comfortable end are here faithfully recorded. Together wit diuers profitable and necessarie instructions; deliuered first in a discourse at his funerall, and now inlarged, and published, for the benefit of others not then present. By T.O. aliàs P. minister of the word of God at Denham in Suffolke
monogr.author: Oldmayne, Timothy

lg.l: ME list not scatch the hidden mysterie
Of Garters Arte, or fetch thine antique stucke
From Troian, Greeke, or Norman gentrie,
Such pride I leaue to the vaine-glorious flocke,
'Mongst whom vaine titles beare the greatest stroke;
Yet some morality these seeme to yeeld
Three Cheurones AZure, in an argent feild.
Argent the badge of spotlesse puritie,
AZure heauens die: Cheurones a constant minde
Three is the number of Diuinitie.
These in thine armes most sweetly are combinde
What good in heauen or earth we erst can finde;
Flectar non srangar, this his Motto speakes,
Although perchaunce he bends he neuer breakes:
Not by the reckelesse stroke of dismall Fate,
Which hath but made this moralls veritie,
Thy purest white hath got the purest state,
Thy constant minde the place of constancie.
The swiftest Creature will may be the crest,
Grayhound.To shew how soone thou gain'st this blessed rest.
